verses.text: \sc The\sc* song of songs, which \add is\add* Solomon’s.
Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth: For thy love \add is\add* better than wine.
Because of the savour of thy good ointments Thy name \add is as\add* ointment poured forth, Therefore do the virgins love thee.
Draw me, we will run after thee: The king hath brought me \add into\add* his chambers: We will be glad and rejoice in thee, We will remember thy love more than wine: The upright love thee.
I \add am\add* black, but comely, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, As the tents of Kedar, as the curtains of Solomon.

Look not upon me, because I \add am\add* black, Because the sun hath looked upon me: My mother’s children were angry with me; They made me the keeper of the vineyards; \add But\add* mine own vineyard have I not kept.
Tell me, O thou whom my soul loveth, Where thou feedest, where thou makest \add thy flock\add* to rest at noon: For why should I be as one that turneth aside by the flocks of thy companions?
If thou know not, O thou fairest among women, Go thy way forth by the footsteps of the flock, And feed thy kids beside the shepherds’ tents.
I have compared thee, O my love, To a company of horses in Pharaoh’s chariots.
Thy cheeks are comely with rows \add of jewels\add*, Thy neck with chains \add of gold\add*.
We will make thee borders of gold With studs of silver.
While the king \add sitteth\add* at his table, My spikenard sendeth forth the smell thereof.
A bundle of myrrh \add is\add* my well-beloved unto me; He shall lie all night betwixt my breasts.
My beloved \add is\add* unto me \add as\add* a cluster of camphire In the vineyards of En-gedi.
Behold, thou \add art\add* fair, my love; behold, thou \add art\add* fair; Thou \add hast\add* doves’ eyes.
Behold, thou \add art\add* fair, my beloved, yea, pleasant: Also our bed \add is\add* green.
The beams of our house \add are\add* cedar, \add And\add* our rafters of fir.
